awd_abstract_narration: This proposal involves collaborative research with Chinese                      scientists from Jilin University on the saddle point method                     and applies the complex coordinate approach to compute                          resonance widths in atoms.  Of particular interest are                          branching ratios between optical and Auger channels, highly                     excited four and five electron systems, core excited Auger                      states spin dependent processes and the interpretation of                       experimental data of highly states.                                                                                                                             This project combines the expertise of the Chinese scientist                    in multi-channel quantum defect methods with the experience                     of Dr. Chung in addressing this useful niche in atomic theory.
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering

pgm_ele.pgm_ele_name: US CHINA COOP IN BASIC SCIENCE
